question: In a golf match, you move your ball marker out of the line of play for another player as they requested. However, you forget to replace the marker to its original position before putting your ball. What happens now?*

choices.text: There is no penalty, continue play as normal.
You must replay the shot from the new marker position without penalty.
You incur a one-stroke penalty and must replace the ball to its correct position before putting it again.
You need to replace the ball to the correct position and have another put. There is no penalty

explanation: If you fail to replace your ball marker to its original position before making a stroke, you incur a one-stroke penalty under the rules of golf. After realizing the mistake, you must replace your ball in the correct position and then continue play.
